extendedIngredients.name: granola
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Gluten Free Granola (I used Bobs Red Mill Honey Oat)

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1- 1½ Tbsp Honey or maple syrup, to taste (or sweetener)

extendedIngredients.name: non-fat greek yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ Cup Plain, non-fat Greek yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: old fashioned rolled oats
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ Cup Old fashioned rolled oatmeal

recipes.title: Avocado Fries with Granola Coconut Crust and Strawberry Yogurt Dip {Gluten free}
recipes.instructions: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.In a food processor, crush the granola just slightly so that it still remains a little chunky. Pour into a large plate and mix with the coconut flakes. Set aside.Add the oats, brown sugar and cinnamon into the food processor and blend until the oats are fine and flour-like. Pour into a large plate.Pour the egg whites into a separate bowl and cut the avocado into wedges (I got 4 wedges per each half of avocado)Coat an avocado wedge in the oatmeal mixture and then in egg white. Finally, press the avocado into the crushed granola, really pressing and packing it on until it coats the avocado wedge. Place onto the prepared baking sheet Repeat for remaining wedges.Spray the avocado fries with cooking spray and bake for 7 minutes. Flip and spray with a little more cooking spray, and bake until golden brown and crispy, about 3-5 minutes.While the fries cook, blend the yogurt, strawberries, and sweetener in a food processor until creamy and smooth.Dip the avocado fries in the sauce and DEVOUR

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.In a food processor, crush the granola just slightly so that it still remains a little chunky.
Pour into a large plate and mix with the coconut flakes. Set aside.
Add the oats, brown sugar and cinnamon into the food processor and blend until the oats are fine and flour-like.

Pour the egg whites into a separate bowl and cut the avocado into wedges (I got 4 wedges per each half of avocado)Coat an avocado wedge in the oatmeal mixture and then in egg white. Finally, press the avocado into the crushed granola, really pressing and packing it on until it coats the avocado wedge.

Place onto the prepared baking sheet Repeat for remaining wedges.Spray the avocado fries with cooking spray and bake for 7 minutes. Flip and spray with a little more cooking spray, and bake until golden brown and crispy, about 3-5 minutes.While the fries cook, blend the yogurt, strawberries, and sweetener in a food processor until creamy and smooth.Dip the avocado fries in the sauce and DEVOUR
